description: Construction of an adjoining part two, part single storey dwelling house; associated amenity space, vehicle parking, formation of crossover, cycle and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Location Plan 00, Proposed Block Plan 00-1, Existing Floorplans 01, Existing Elevations 02, Proposed Ground Floor Plan 03A, Proposed First Floor and Roof Plan 04, Proposed Front Elevation Plan 05, Proposed Rear Elevation Plan 06, Proposed Crossover Plan 07A, Revised Design and Access Statement by ew.arch (submitted May 2024), Planning Statement by ew.arch (March 2024)  Tree Survey, Arboricultural Impact Assessment, Arboricultural Method Statement & Tree Protection Plan by Usherwood Arboriculture (May 2024).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A - F of Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment to that order) no extensions, new windows or other alterations shall be carried out at the dwellinghouses hereby approved without the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site, to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the area, and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1, D4 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | All external materials to be used in the development shall match as closely as possible the appearance of those of the existing dwelling at No. 135 Ferrymead Avenue.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B; London Plan (2021) policy D3 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The refuse storage area shown on the approved plans shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained unobstructed in perpetuity.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy SI7 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The cycle storage areas shown on the approved plans shall provide at least 2 long stay cycle parking spaces in accordance with policy and these shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate bicycle storage provision and in the interests of reducing congestion to the local transport network, in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) and 3.1(i) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The private amenity area shown on the approved plans shall be laid out prior to first occupation of the dwelling hereby permitted and retained in perpetuity thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision of amenity space within the site in accordance with London Plan Policy D6 and Policy 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise sources including transport/ industrial/ commercial/ cultural uses and their noise levels occurring at the site during most of the year, i.e. measured during school and work weekdays, in accordance with internal noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). Best practicable mitigation measures shall also be implemented, as necessary, in external amenity spaces to achieve criteria of BS8233:2014.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),

- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,  - public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works in case of emergencies or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to occupation of the dwelling hereby approved a timber fence 1.8m high shall be provided between the private amenity areas of the approved dwelling and of No. 135 Ferrymead Avenue and this fencing shall be permanently retained.

Reason: To protect the residential amenity of residents of the dwellings and ensure adequate provision of private amenity space in accordance with policies 1.1 and 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | No operations to construct the pavement crossover herby approved shall commence on site until measures for protection of the nearby street tree have been implemented as specified in the submitted Arboricultural Method Statement & Tree Protection Plan by Usherwood Arboriculture (May 2024). All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement & Tree Protection Plan shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G4, G5 and G7 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD and the Ealing SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | Prior to occupation of the dwelling hereby approved the hard/soft landscape works and boundary treatments shown on approved plan 03 shall be implemented. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and amenity of prospective occupiers, and in accordance with policies G5 and G7 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(b) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
